### Problem

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5c43ddc6-f572-41c9-b308-2ed2a38d94e0

### Steps to reproduce

1. run `nvim --clean -u minimal.lua`
2. press `w` to open a window
3. press `w` again to close the window (The rightmost edge of the screen has a vertical window separator column❌)
4. keep pressing `w` (The newly opened window suddenly has a smaller size❌)
5. keep pressing `w` (The window with `winfixwidth` set is expanding unexpectedly❌)

minimal.lua:

```
local open_win = function()
	return
	vim.api.nvim_open_win(
		0,
		false,
		{
			win = -1,
			split = "right",
			width = 20,
		}
	)
end

local win1
win1 = open_win()
vim.api.nvim_set_option_value("winfixwidth", true, {win = win1})

local win2
local toggle_win2 = function()
	if win2 == nil then
		win2 = open_win()
	else
		vim.api.nvim_win_close(win2, true)
		win2 = nil
	end
end
vim.keymap.set("n", "w", toggle_win2)

vim.o.winbar = "%{%v:lua.wn()%}"
wn = function()
	return vim.api.nvim_get_current_win()
end
```

### Expected behavior

eliminate all ❌

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.11.0-dev-1948+gc53e00889d

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

not sure

### Operating system/version

6.13.5-arch1-1

### Terminal name/version

st 0.8.5

### $TERM environment variable

st-256color

### Installation

nightly
